name: Schoppe
author: Will Brouwers
body:
Historie

The Schoppe was a small yacht from the fleet of admiral Jol. The fleet was intended to capture (part of) the Spanish silverfleet of 1640.

A violent storm that raged on 11 september 1640 discarded the fleet. Four ships stranded near Habanna. The remainder of the fleet sailed in the bay of Matanzas. The Schoppe was badly damaged and stayed behind while the rest sailed back to Recife in Brasil.

Beschrijving

Type: warship yacht
Built: Amsterdam < 1636
Owner: WIC Amsterdam
Complement: 43, 25 crew, 18 soldiers
Tonnage: 60 last
Armament: 2 bronze, 6 iron

Referenties

  • De Laet, IV, 200.
  • OWIC, 1.05.01.01, 55,35,134.
  • OWIC 1.05.01.01. 68, 1567, fol 123.
